head.supplied: 31/1/78 ¶ ¶ I learn, dear Mr Ramsay, that a Gov Schooner proceeds to New Guinea. So says Mr Lawes. Would you be so very friendly to induce the officers to dry for me flowering & fruiting specimens of...

div.p: ML MSS.562, Letters to E. P. Ramsay 1862-91, Mitchell Library, State Library of New South Wales, Sydney.

I learn, dear Mr Ramsay, that a Gov Schooner proceeds to New Guinea. So says Mr Lawes. Would you be so very friendly to induce the officers to dry for me flowering & fruiting specimens of any kind, and place a ream of paper on my expense on board, explaining how simply the drying process is effected.
